definition: to consult/to ask for advice
to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
surname Jiao
to teach
religion/teaching/to make/to cause/to tell

sentences.english: When the Master entered, they asked him exactly what the words meant.
sentences.chinese: 大师进来时，他们纷纷前来讨教这话的含义。

sentences.english: Qi asked how to deal with obstacles or frustrations at work.
sentences.chinese: 齐林讨教了如何去处理工作中的障碍或挫折的问题。

sentences.english: I may have to ask for your advice later on.
sentences.chinese: 以后少不得要去向您讨教。

sentences.english: Within ten years, they were millionaires, and people were coming to Steve for advice.
sentences.chinese: 十年间，他们成为百万富翁，人们来向史蒂夫讨教。

definition: to ask for guidance/to consult
to ask for advice/seeking instruction
to impart/to pass on/to teach
to point out/to indicate/to give directions/to show how (to do sth)/to censure/to pick at
to compare notes/to learn from one another/to swap pointers
to give advice or comments
not feel ashamed to ask and learn from one's subordinates
to pay a visit/to call on
much obliged/thank you/to ask advice/(ironically or humorously) to experience/to taste
what one has learned (through experience, reading etc)/knowledge/insight/understanding/tips/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to introduce (sb)/(esp.) to present to the emperor
to give instructions/to give advice
to formally become an apprentice to a master
to visit sb at home
to dispel doubts/to clear up confusion
to show off/to make a display of
